Course information
In addition to a substantial research thesis of up to 80,000 words, PhD students are also required to undertake a range of professional development activities.
Entry requirements
Admission criteria for research courses requires one of the following minimum qualifications in a relevant discipline:
a four-year bachelor's degree which normally includes a research component in the fourth year, leading to honours 1 or 2A; or a coursework master's degree with a significant research component including at least 25% of one full-time equivalent year of work, including a thesis (Please note that it is normally expected that a grade of honours 2A has been obtained for the research thesis or project); or a qualification which the Graduate Research Committee has deemed equivalent.
Applicants must also meet the university English language requirements.
How to apply
Once you feel you meet the admission criteria, you need to decide on a research area. The key research themes of the Monash Business School are:
Global business Health and wellbeing Sustainability and development
Research in the Monash Business School however can be completed in any field where sufficient expertise and resources are available. While deciding on a topic, you can browse our seven departments and research centres to see which is most related to your area of research interest.
Next, you will lodge an Expression of Interest (EOI) form by submitting it to appropriate academic unit related to your area of interest (see form for the list of contacts). If you have also identified a potential supervisor, you can indicate this in your EOI.
You can contact specific departments within the faculty for further supervisor information.
If your EOI is supported, you will be sent an invitation to formally apply. Please allow four weeks after sending in your EOI for an outcome
You can refer to the How to apply web page for more information.
Course fees
Domestic: The Australian government covers the tuition fees for all domestic research students. You will be required to pay an annual Student Services and Amenities Fee (SSAF).
International: Fees are subject to change annually. The international student fee for 2016 is $28,900 AUD per full-time year.
Scholarships opportunities are available, including research scholarships specific to Monash Business School students.
Further information
For more details about research with the Monash Business School, I encourage you to view the research website and browse the 2016 Handbook entry for full course requirements.
You are also welcome to contact the Monash Business School directly:
